text: Simon went to the emperor to complain that a poor Galilean was doing greater miracles than he. Peter went up to Simon to see which of the two was superior in his service. "Tell me what I'm thinking", Simon said to Peter. - Let the Emperor give me a barley bread, and see if I know what you keep in your soul. He was given the bread. Immediately Simon made two great dogs appear to devour him. Peter threw the bread at them and, as they were eating, said, "Good! Did I know or not what you were thinking? You wanted to make me eat your dogs. Finished Philosophical Dictionary, 1764
title: Simón el mago
author: nan Voltaire
